Thanks for the PR. I haven't done this yet because our system tests infrastructure still requires Java 7. Once that is fixed and the various Jenkins jobs are updated, we can make this change.
The relevant JIRA is https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-4423 by the way.

Hmm, how is this PR passing given that we still have outstanding PRs for fixing findBugs warnings?

One general question: is it possible to iterate on these RPCs as we do the implementation without bumping the version? I am talking specifically about the new ones.

We may find some things which don't make sense when we actually implement the code on the client and server, so it would be good to not have to keep bumping the version for the changes we make before the release.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.11/2771/
Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.11).

Good question. Generally, we aim to bump the protocol version after each update (I think we should change this, but that's a separate discussion). In this case, we definitely don't need to do that until we have implemented the handlers in `KafkaApis` (no-one can depend on a protocol API that is not implemented).

If we need to make changes after the handlers are implemented, then we need to consider if it would have an impact on people upgrading from trunk. If there's no impact, then it's an easy one. If there is impact, then let's discuss it at the time.

I think this is already included in https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2780, which was submitted shortly before this one.

I pushed some clean up items. I also set off a branch builder which will loop on the replication_test.py 30 times. It's build 827 on branch builder 1:
 https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/
Sounds good. Thanks!
@ijuma can't find any change to the file changed here in that one? (could be wrong it's well past midnight here :D)
Hmm, I thought I saw that change in another PR. But you're right that it doesn't seem to be #2780. I'll merge this one.

Ah, I was right that I had seen that change in another PR: https://github.com/apache/kafka/commit/aea14651184476940c69238535de5143e61f4c31

So, I think we should close this one.
@ijuma sure, closing :)

Call for review @miguno @enothereska @dguy (this would go into `0.10.2.1` if possible, too)

Found a second bug adding new test: we need to "ensure co-partitioning" before creating topic partitions we assign later because co-partitioning might change the number of partitions for topics.

Yes, this is one case where I wanted to see a failure.  And, of course, I didn't get it :)

It should be fixed now.  It seems that findbugs was not run automatically previously.  I changed it so that the test phase now depends on findbugs.
